newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss bond market closing report.
newsitem.headline: Swiss bond market closing report.

text.p: Swiss bonds extended gains Wednesday ahead of a bank holiday in Zurich on Thursday.

The June Confederate bond futures contract regained the March 17 high of 119.72 during the session, and closed firm but off highs. Traders saw strong demand for three- to five-year bonds and medium-term "Comi" futures.

"The market is in really good shape and we have seen major trades in shorter maturities including Comi-related trades," said one trader at a Swiss bank. He added that the curve was likely to continue to steepen.
Comi futures ended Wednesday up 17 basis points at 111.55.
"Conf" futures ended 20 basis points higher at 119.64

In the short end of the market, trade was quiet. Tomorrow/next money was quoted late on Wednesday around 1-1/2 percent, off peaks seen earlier this week, when the rate tightened on technical factors ahead of month's end.
The next key domestic event for the market may be a speech by Swiss National Bank board member Bruno Gehrig set for Friday.
On Wednesday, SNB chairman Hans Meyer was quoted in the Basler Zeitung daily as saying that foreign demand remained a key to the country's future economic performance.
Markets focused on Meyer's comment that the Swiss National Bank did not conduct exchange rate policy, but monetary policy. The remark temporarily boosted the Swiss franc.
Euro Swiss francs up one at 98.21.
